source: ISO 14971:2019 + FDA Orthopedic Device Guidance + ASTM F2423

hazards.description: Loss of fixation between implant and bone
hazards.harm: Pain, loss of function, revision surgery required
typical_controls: Porous coating for bone ingrowth (per ASTM F1854)
Hydroxyapatite coating (if applicable)
Press-fit sizing guidelines
Preclinical wear testing (ISO 14243 for knees, ISO 14242 for hips)
Clinical radiographic surveillance at 1, 2, 5, 10 years
Instructions for cement technique (if cemented)

hazards.description: Particulate wear from articulating surfaces induces bone resorption
hazards.harm: Periprosthetic osteolysis, implant loosening, revision surgery
typical_controls: Highly cross-linked polyethylene (HXLPE) for reduced wear
Simulator wear testing (ISO 14243, ISO 14242) for ≥5 million cycles
Particulate testing per ISO 10993-12
Alignment instrumentation to prevent edge loading
Post-market surveillance for osteolysis rates
Material biocompatibility per ISO 10993 series

hazards.description: Bacterial colonization of implant and surrounding tissue
hazards.harm: Deep infection requiring implant removal, sepsis, chronic osteomyelitis
typical_controls: Terminal sterilization (steam, EO, radiation per ISO 11135/11137)
Sterility assurance level (SAL) of 10^-6
Sterility testing per ISO 11737
Instructions for aseptic surgical technique
Antimicrobial coatings (if applicable - validation required)
Post-market surveillance for infection rates (<1% target for primary THA/TKA)

hazards.description: Implant sinks into bone over time due to inadequate support
hazards.harm: Loss of anatomical alignment, pain, functional impairment
typical_controls: Compressive testing of bone-implant interface (ASTM F1717 for spinal)
Sizing guidelines based on bone density and anatomy
Instructions for bone preparation technique
Weight-bearing restrictions during healing period
Clinical radiographic monitoring (subsidence >3mm at 2 years = failure)

hazards.description: Joint components separate from normal articulation (e.g., hip dislocation)
hazards.harm: Pain, loss of function, closed or open reduction required, revision surgery
typical_controls: Range of motion testing to validate impingement-free arc
Surgical instrumentation for accurate component positioning
Dual-mobility designs (if applicable)
Instructions for optimal acetabular cup positioning (40-45° inclination)
Patient activity restrictions during healing
Clinical dislocation rate monitoring (<3% at 2 years for THA)

hazards.description: Bone fracture adjacent to implant or fracture of implant itself
hazards.harm: Loss of fixation, pain, revision surgery, potential for non-union
common_causes: Stress shielding leading to bone loss
typical_controls: Fatigue testing per ASTM F1717 (spinal), ASTM F1800 (femoral stems)
Material specification (Ti-6Al-4V per ASTM F136, CoCr per ASTM F75)
Finite element analysis for stress distribution
Instructions for component sizing and positioning
Post-market surveillance for fracture rates
Warnings about osteoporosis and fall risk

hazards.description: Damage to nerves or blood vessels during implantation
hazards.harm: Neuropathy, vascular injury, limb ischemia, chronic pain
common_causes: Drill or screw penetration beyond cortex
Leg length discrepancy causing nerve stretch
typical_controls: Atraumatic surgical instrumentation design
Instructions for neurovascular anatomy awareness
Fluoroscopic or navigation guidance
Warnings about proximity to critical structures (e.g., sciatic nerve in THA)
Surgeon training and credentialing
Pre-operative imaging to assess anatomy

hazards.description: Accumulation of metal debris in soft tissue from implant wear or corrosion
hazards.harm: Pseudotumor formation, soft tissue necrosis, systemic metal ion elevation
hazards.iso14971_reference: Annex E - Biological hazards - Metal ions
typical_controls: Corrosion testing per ASTM F1801 (fretting corrosion)
Material compatibility at modular junctions (avoid mixed metals)
Simulator wear testing for metal-on-metal bearings (if applicable)
Clinical metal ion monitoring (Cr, Co levels in blood)
Post-market surveillance for pseudotumor incidence
Warnings about MoM bearing risks (if applicable)

hazards.description: Separation of modular implant components (e.g., head from stem)
hazards.harm: Loss of function, revision surgery, potential for injury from loose component
typical_controls: Taper lock testing per ISO 7206-10 (hip stems)
Manufacturing tolerances for taper geometry
Instructions for proper impaction technique and force
Post-market surveillance for dissociation events
Warnings about revision surgery risks if components mixed from different manufacturers

hazards.description: Hypersensitivity or inflammatory response to implant materials
hazards.harm: Pain, dermatitis, implant loosening, tissue necrosis
typical_controls: Material biocompatibility per ISO 10993-5 (cytotoxicity), -10 (sensitization)
Use of low-nickel or nickel-free alloys (Ti-6Al-4V, CoCrMo)
Patient screening for metal allergies (if applicable)
Instructions to inquire about patient allergy history
Post-market surveillance for adverse tissue reactions
Alternative materials (ceramic, oxidized zirconium) for high-risk patients

severity_scale.1: Negligible - No injury or health effect
severity_scale.2: Minor - Temporary injury requiring first aid
severity_scale.4: Critical - Permanent impairment or life-threatening injury
severity_scale.5: Catastrophic - Death or irreversible severe injury
